page.title: 13TWO WRAGBY PEOPLE
page.content: There is a blacksmith in{Wragby} village, but nowadays he is not as busy as in the past since most of the village's residents are elderly and have no need of his services. The stables at Nostell Priory used to provide a big demand for his skills , but then they acquired their own blacksmiths to work on site. This meant the Wragby smith lost his major customer. Not far from the black smith's house is {Longley Labrador Kennels,}set in an open area near {Longley Woods }.The kennels no longer operate as a full time working business because of a fall in demand and because of health problems The owner merely keeps the dogs for a hobby. 'Longley' is a prefix which was given by the kennel club.
